ofc4j
Class OFC

java.lang.Object
  ofc4j.OFC

public class OFC
extends Object

This is the class responsible for converting a Chart object into the JSON string which feeds the charting widget. There is no need to make explicit use of this class, but if necessary, there are several ways to do so:

  1. The "instance" field contains a static instance of an OFC object.
  2. The Chart object overrides toString() and uses this instance to render itself.
  3. For tricky threading situations, you may prefer to create and manage instances of OFC yourself.

Theoretically, XStream (the JSON conversion library used here) is thread-safe, but it does not hurt to have the option to synchronize or to have thread local instances, whatever may be necessary.

render

public String render(Chart c)
              throws OFCException
Use this method in your applications to send data back to the chart widget.

Parameters:
c - the chart to render
Returns:
the JSONified chart data
Throws:
OFCException - when rendering fails

                   throws OFCException

Throws:

toArray

public static <T> T[] toArray(Collection<T> collection,
                              Class<? extends T> type)
Convenience method for converting Collections to Arrays. You can use this where the API has limited support for collections: getLabels().addLabels(OFC.toArray(stringList, String.class));

Parameters:
collection - The collection to use
type - The supertype for the collection. This will commonly be Integer, Number, etc.
Returns:
the array of the collection

stringify

public static List<String> stringify(List<? extends Object> source)
Convenience method to generate labels from a collection of Objects, if so desired.

Parameters:
source - the source collection holding Objects.
Returns:
a collection of all the objects toString() method invoked

stringify

public static String[] stringify(Object... objects)
Convenience method to generate labels from an array of disparate Objects.

Parameters:
objects - the array of objects to convert
Returns:
a collection of all the objects toString() result
